forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 52. West southwest wind around 6 mph.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain after 5pm. Partly sunny. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 3 to 13 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the dawn stretches gently across Downtown San Francisco, the atmosphere retains a soft blanket of cloudiness. The temperature rests pleasantly around a mild 52 degrees, accompanied by a subtle breeze from the west southwest that whispers through the streets. While the morning begins with a moody charm, hints of rain gather strength, threatening to unveil themselves later in the day. By the afternoon, the clouds will part slightly, wrestling with the erratic sunshine that breaks through, offering glimpses of a peaked blue sky above the muted gray.

As the clock ticks towards the late afternoon, prepare for the rain’s arrival—forecasters predict it will join the scene after five o’clock with a 90% chance of soft, persistent showers. Though the higher temperatures flirt with 62 degrees, a quick drop to a cooler 60 will remind you of the city's ever-shifting moods. For today, a lightweight coat or an umbrella will be your best companions—unassuming but essential tools for navigating the coming weather. Given the low visibility often attributed to the marine layer, activities could be as simple yet satisfying as exploring the cozy corners of local coffee shops or settling into a comfortable chair in a bookstore, allowing the sounds of rain to accompany your moments of reflection.
